page.title: 07The Railway Line
page.content: {THE RAILWAY LINE} The Cental Line, running from London Marylebone to Sheffield opened for coal in July 1898 & passengers in March 1899. It ceased to operate on Sept. 3rd, 1966. It is however still very visible by its banks as a disused line. All the rails were taken away in 1966 but along the line a few mile- stones still survive. The line is now used again by the farmers. The biggest farm is a pig unit which is where the Railway Signal Box & sidings were. The Old Railway House is still lived in but bigger than when it was first built. One part of the line has been turned into a Conservation Area where trees of all sorts have grown & the animal life is very interesting. Pheasants, Partridges and Foxes all live close together. The bridges have survived into the modern day.
